title: Allow Clubs and BOC users to create a Place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction from Player History
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Club or BOC user wants to create a Place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction from Player History
AND user has navigated to a player's Player History Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks the "Create New" button on Player's Player History Widget
custom_expected:
THEN "Transactions" should be an option in the top-level dropdown
AND clicking "Transactions" option should cause "Major" and "Minor" radio buttons to be active
AND selecting "Major" should limit the third and fourth levels to only Major items
AND "Injured List" should appear as an option under Major Transactions
AND "Place on 7 day Concussion IL" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown

title: Earliest Reinstatement Date
custom_preconds: GIVEN user wants the Earliest Reinstatement date calculated correctly on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user enters or changes the Placement Date on a Place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction
custom_expected: THEN the system will calculate and display Earliest Reinstatement Date as the 8th day after the Placement Date (including the Placement Date)

title: Allow Club user to submit a place on 7-Day Concussion IL to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Club user is attempting to submit a place on 7-Day Concussion IL to the BOC for approval
AND the form is in a preliminary or rejected status
AND the blue Submit button is available
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit
custom_expected:
THEN the system should run a required field and format check according to the data discovery
AND the system should run the On Submit rules check
AND once the rules have passed, the system should update the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"
AND the system should reload the transaction in view mode, and display a successful submit blue notification
AND the system should create an entry in green font in the player's Player History [Code = IL07J, Description = Place on 7-day Concussion IL]
AND player's pending major league roster status should change to "7-Day Concussion IL"

title: Allow BOC user to reject a place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction has been submitted to BOC
AND grey "Reject" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps:
WHEN BOC user clicks "Reject"
AND all On Save rules have passed or been overridden
custom_expected:
THEN the transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND successful reject notification #78 is displayed
AND item is removed from the approvals clipboard
AND player's pending Major League Roster status is reversed
AND pending player history entry is removed

title: Allow BOC user to approve a place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction has been submitted to the BOC
AND transaction is in  Preliminary, Submitted to BOC, or Rejected status
AND blue "Approve" button is available
custom_steps:
WHEN the BOC user clicks "Approve"
AND all rules have passed or been overridden
custom_expected:
THEN the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND item is reloaded in view mode if it was in edit mode
AND a successful blue notification (#80) is displayed that states the transaction was approved
AND item is removed from the approvals clipboard
AND player's Player History is updated: Code = IL07J Description = Place on 7-day Concussion IL, From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields should be in black font
AND player's Major League Roster status is set to 7-Day Concussion IL

title: Allow BOC user to reverse a Place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction has been submitted and approved for a player
AND BOC user sees a "Reverse" button in grey on the transaction
custom_steps:
WHEN BOC user clicks "Reverse"
AND all required field and formatting checks are passed
custom_expected:
THEN successful reverse notification (#79) should be displayed
AND transaction status should be updated to "Reversed"
AND reversed transaction is displayed in Player History with "Voided": in front of transaction description (EX:"Voided: Selection to ML Roster√ì)
AND any action item generated for Club user is removed

title: Allow user to delete a Place on 7-Day Concussion IL
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user wants to delete a Place on 7-Day Concussion IL transaction
AND user has edit permissions
AND transaction is in Preliminary or Rejected sate
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the grey Delete button in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN system should prompt user with " Are you sure you want to delete this [form]?"
AND clicking yes will delete and close the form and return user to entry point
AND clicking no will return the user to the form and take no action

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to place a player on the IL out of season
custom_preconds: GiVEN user wants to receive error
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks SUBMIT or APPROVE (all places OnSubmit rules are fired)
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the entered placement date falls between the start of spring training and the submitting Org's Last day of Season date (including post season)
IF 'placement date' does not fall during season, THEN an error will be shown
AND message will display:
"The player must be placed between the open and closing date of the season, from {0} to {1}
- {0} should be replaced with the start of Spring Training system date."
- {1} should be replaced with the player's Club's Last Day of Season system date.
AND Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction.
AND Clicking Ignore and Continue (only available for the BOC) will ignore the error and continue with the transaction.

title: Error message when attempting to place a player who is at the MN level
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user wants to place a player on the 7-Day Concussion IL 
AND selected player's pending roster status is at the minor league level
custom_steps: WHEN user selects "Place on 7-Day Concussion IL" from the "Create New" menu
custom_expected:
THEN user will receive error message "This transaction is for Major League players only."
AND clicking "Back" button will close the modal and return user to the point of entry

title: Error if the player I am attempting to place on the 7 Day Concussion IL has stats from a game played on the Placement Date or after the Placement date if there is a doubleheader exception
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #4.11.1:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3786710/4.+Place+on+7-Day+Concussion+DL

See Error Messages #63:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3786726/DL+-+Messages

GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Place on 7 Day Concussion IL transaction for a player
AND player has stats from a game played on or after the Placement Date on the transaction (as shown on stats tab of profile with "Game Logs" selected)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve" (all places where onSubmit rules are fired)
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the player has any stats from a game played on or after the Placement Date
AND the system should check for all stats found on the stats table(hitting, pitching, etc)
AND if stats for a game played on the Placement date and the doubleheader checkbox is not checked, then system should show an error
BUT if the doubleheader checkbox is checked, then the player may have stats from a game that occurred on the same day as the Placement date but not after. 
AND if stats from a game that occurred after the Placement date are found with the checkbox checked, then system should show an error
AND message should be as follows:
Body:"Stats have been found for player on {0}."
AND "{0}" should be replaced with the game date that the system found stats for as "mm/dd/yyyy"
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction
AND clicking Ignore and Continue (only available for the BOC) should ignore the error and continue with the transaction

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the player I'm attempting to place on the 7-Day Concussion IL is at the MN level

custom_steps: WHEN user selects "Place on 7-Day Concussion IL" from the Create New menu
custom_expected:

AND message should be as follows:
Title: "Error"
Body: "This transaction is for Major League players only."
Button(s): Back
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the point of entry

title: As a user I want to submit a place on 10-day IL to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: Given user has created 10 day-IL transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user open 10-day transaction in the status of  "preliminary"
custom_expected:
THEN Submit to BOC button is available to Club users when the preliminary or rejected form is in edit mode or view mode. The button is blue. 
AND Submit button is available for BOC users when the preliminary or rejected form is in edit mode or view mode. The button is grey.
AND Clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. 
AND Clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND After the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"
AND System reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification. 
AND Once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in Player's Player History: Code = IL10J, Description = Place on 10-day IL

title: As a user I want to be able to add a new Authorized Signatory from a Place on 10-Day IL transaction
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 10 day IL
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=add_new_signatory_or_negotiator

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The Authorized Signatory field on the transaction will only contain a list of the Authorized Signatories with MJ Transactions checked off in the Auth Signatories widget, that belong to the Org for which this transaction is being done. (Org displayed on the transaction) 
* A "New" link appears above the Authorized Signatory field in edit mode if the user has edit capabilities for the authorized signatory widget. If they do not have permissions, the New link does not appear.

* The Save button will be Injured until all required fields have been populated.
* Clicking "Save" will add the authorized signatory to the system and close the modal, with the "Authorized Signatory" field pre-populated with the newly added Authorized Signatory. 
* The Authorized SIgnatory will be added to the authorized signatory widget and will appear for the Org for all users that have permission to view that Org's Authorized Signatories.
* Clicking Cancel will cancel the addition of the authorized signatory, and return the user to the form.

title: Place on 10-Day IL Permissions - Club - Major Transactions
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 10 day IL
custom_steps:
Roles and Permissions: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2304252

Acceptance Criteria: 
ADMIN: 
* Club users with this role can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
* Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Majnor League transactions for Major League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".


BASIC:
* Club users with this role can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
* Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" (all places OnSubmit rules are fired) will check if the Exam Date entered on the transaction is more than 10 days ago (can be equal to 10 days ago). If yes, then a warning will be shown.
Message
Body: "Exam Date entered is more than 10 days ago. Please enter the most recent exam date for the player."
Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction.
Clicking Ignore and Continue will ignore the error and continue with the transaction.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the player I'm creating a place on 60-Day IL transaction for does not have a valid MJ roster status
custom_steps:
Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" (all places OnSubmit rules are fired) will check if the player√ïs pending (or current if pending is not populated) major league roster status is Active or Active Pending Contract. If no, then an error will be shown.
Message
Body: "Player must be Active, or Active Pending Contract to be placed on the IL."
Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the player I am creating a place on 60-day IL for has a pending or approved transaction after the entered assignment date
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:

Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" will check if the Placement date is before the latest approved or pending (Pending to Club, Submitted to BOC) transaction date for the player. If it is, an error will display.
Message
Body: "A transaction cannot occur before the date of <Roster Name Last Name>'s latest approved or pending transaction, on <TX Date>."
Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction.
Clicking Ignore and Continue (only available for the BOC) will ignore the error and continue with the transaction.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Transfer to 10-Day IL transaction for a player

cba change, Injured list, mj IL - transfer to 10 day IL
custom_steps:
WHEN selecting √íCreate New√ì, "Transactions", "Major", "Injured list", √íPlace on 10-day IL"

See Data Discovery: 
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2304538

title: As a user I want to edit an existing transfer to 10-day IL transaction for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN a transfer to 10-Day IL transaction exists for a player
custom_steps: WHEN club or BOC user with edit permissions navigates to the form in view mode
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button should be available
AND clicking  Edit should reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button should appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode)
AND in Preliminary and Rejected, the Club and BOC users should be able to edit all portions displayed on the form
AND edit should only gives clubs access to attach new files(and check SFD checkbox if file is uploaded) and edit auth sig in any state other than Preliminary or Rejected. Club should not be able to edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction
BUT BOC should be able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions
AND in Approved and Reversed (including suppressed) transactions, edit should only give BOC access to attach new files, edit existing attachments, update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, as well as edit any other part of the transaction not specifically stated as not editable post-approval in the data discovery

title: As a user I want to save a transfer to 10-day IL transaction for a player
custom_preconds: GIVEN a transfer to 10 Day IL transaction exists for a player
custom_steps: WHEN a club or BOC user with edit permissions has navigated to the form in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN a Save button should be available
AND clicking Save should save the transaction and it's current values and reload the transaction in view mode 
AND required field and format checks should only be made if the transaction is in a submitted or higher state
AND transaction status should be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status should not change
AND after a successful save the system should display a successful save blue notification. See Messages #77
AND whenever the form is in edit mode, the user should see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey

title: As a user I want to cancel creation of or changes to transfer to 10-day IL transaction for a player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
AND user is attempting to create a new Transfer to 10-Day IL transaction
OR user is attempting to edit an existing transaction
AND user has the form open in edit mode
AND "Cancel" button is available on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Cancel"
custom_expected:
THEN system should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made
AND if they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction
BUT f they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected
AND if they do not confirm the cancellation then the user should be returned to the form and no action should be taken

title: As a user I want to submit a Transfer to the 10-Day IL to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
AND user is attempting to submit a Transfer to 10-Day IL tx for a player
custom_steps: WHEN user has navigated to the form in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN Submit to BOC button should be available to Club users when the preliminary or rejected form is in edit mode or view mode. The button should be blue
AND Submit button should be available for BOC users when the preliminary or rejected form is in edit mode or view mode. The button should be grey
AND clicking Submit should run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message
AND clicking Submit should run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass)
AND after the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
AND system should reload the transaction in view mode, and display a successful submit blue notification. Messages #76
AND if the player's pending MJ roster status is Rehab 7 Day Concussion IL then their pending MJ Roster Status should be set to to Rehab 10 Day IL
AND if the player's pending MJ roster status is 7 Day Concussion IL then the player's pending MJ roster status should be set to to 10 Day IL
AND once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in green font in Player's Player History: Code = TR10J, Description = Transfer to 10-Day IL, From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields
AND when a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item should be generated and display on the BOC - Major Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget
AND if a file is attached to the transaction, that should be displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget
AND if Comments are populated on the transaction, they should display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget
AND player name should be a hyperlink in the Approvals widget
AND clicking on the player name should open the Player Profile (defaults to Player History tab) in the same window/tab
AND  "Type" should be a hyperlink
AND clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction should open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab

title: As a BOC user I want to approve or reject a transfer to 10-day IL transaction
custom_preconds:
cba change, Injured list, mj IL - transfer to 10 day IL

GIVEN that BOC wants to Approve or Reject a Transfer
custom_steps: WHEN BOC is viewing a transaction(in view or edit mode) in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC or Rejected state.
custom_expected:
THEN
   APPROVE:
* BOC Approvers will see an "Approve" button in blue when Transaction is in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC and Rejected states.
* Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages.
* Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode.
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved. See Messages #80.
* If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard.
* Update Player's Player History: Code = TR10J Description = Transfer to 10-Day IL, From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields to be in black font.
* If the player√ïs current MJ roster status is Rehab 7 Day Concussion IL, then set the player's MJ Roster Status to Rehab 10 Day IL.
* If the player's current MJ roster status is 7 Day Concussion IL, then set the player's MJ roster status to 10 Day IL
OR
   REJECT:
* BOC Approvers will see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction in the Submitted to BOC state only.
* Clicking "Reject" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages (all covered in previous stories).
* Once all On Save rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
* Successful reject notification is displayed. See Messages #78.
* If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard.
* Reverse player's pending Major League Roster status.
* Remove pending player history entry.
* Remove any action items that were generated regarding the transaction.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse, suppress or reverse and suppress a Transfer to 10-Day IL transaction
custom_preconds:
See Reverse Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/3.+Transfer+to+10-Day+DL
See Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages

GIVEN user is logged in as BOC and is viewing a Transfer to 10-day IL transaction which is in Approved status
custom_steps: When BOC user clicks reverse, suppress,  or reverse & suppress
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers should see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state
AND clicking "Reverse" should run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run
AND a successful reverse notification should be displayed. See Messages #79
AND the transaction status should be updated to "Reversed"
AND any action items that were generated as a result of this transaction being submitted or approved should be removed.
AND system should display reversed transaction in player history with "Voided" appended
AND users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode
AND clicking "Reverse and Suppress" should first reverse, and then suppress the transaction
AND clicking "Suppress" should suppress the transaction
AND when a transaction is suppressed it should be hidden from the player's Player History, Searches (unless BOC user specifically searches suppressed transactions), and any other place where it is visible on UI
AND clicking "Reverse" or "Reverse and Suppress", should check if the current transaction is the most recent approved transaction 
AND if the transaction is not the most recent approved transaction for the player, then the user should receive an error message stating:
"Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed." 
AND user should ONLY have the back option
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction

title: Transfer to 10-Day IL Permissions - Club - Major Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as a club admin or viewer
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to perform any action on a Transfer to 10 Day IL transaction
custom_expected:
THEN if the user is a CLUB ADMIN the user should be able to view and print all Transfer to 10 Day IL(MJ) transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.
BUT user should NOT be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND user should NOT be able to view transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND club users with this role should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) Transfer to 10 Day IL(MJ) transactions including other club's Transfer to 10 Day IL(MJ) transactions
BUT user should NOT be able to see BOC Notes field for any Transfer to 10 Day IL(MJ) transactions
AND user should NOT be able to see the Comments field for any Transfer to 10 Day IL(MJ) transactions unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. (Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org)
AND user should NOT be able to see attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
AND user should be able to create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Transfer to 10 Day IL(MJ) transactions for Major League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

BUT if user is logged in as CLUB VIEWER
THEN user should be able to view and print all Transfer to 10 Day IL(MJ) transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too
BUT user should NOT be able to see Transactions that are in Suppressed state
AND user should NOT be able to edit or change these transactions (Viewer only)
AND user should NOT be able to see "BOC Notes" field
AND club users with this role should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) Transfer to 10 Day IL(MJ) transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions 
BUT user should NOT be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should NOT see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND user should NOT be able to see attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

custom_steps: WHEN "Place on Rehab Assignment" tx is loaded, saved, or goes through any state change
custom_expected:
THEN system should correctly calculate Last Rehab Date for the tx
AND Last Rehab Date should be calculated as Assignment Date + Number of Days for Rehab. (Ex: Assignment Date 4/14/16 and # of days = 30, then the Last Rehab Date is 5/13/2016)

title: BOC user wants to add an Extension to Approved Rehab Assignment
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user is viewing an existing "Place on Rehabilitation Assignment" tx for a player
AND tx is in "Approved" state
AND "Add Extension" button is visible
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Add Extension"
custom_expected:
THEN Extension section should be added to the form
AND Extension section should match data discovery and wireframe
AND user should be able to complete Extension section and click "Save" on the tx
AND clicking "Save" should run all on Save rule checks and required field and formatting checks
AND successful save blue notification should display

title: BOC user wants to add additional Extension to Approved Rehab Assignment
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and viewing a Rehab Assignment tx for a player
AND the tx is in an Approved State
AND the tx has at least one extension added
AND "Add Extension" button is visible beneath latest extension
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks "Add Extension" button
custom_expected:
THEN an additional Extension section should be added to the form
AND extension section should match data discovery and wireframe
AND user should be able to complete extension section and click "Save" on the tx
AND clicking save should run all on Save rule checks and required field and formatting checks
AND successful save blue notification should display

title: BOC user wants to edit existing Rehab Assignment tx - Approved or Reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Place on Rehabilitation Assignment" transaction already exists for a player
AND user is logged in as BOC user
AND form is in Approved or Reversed state
AND "Edit" button is displayed on form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Edit" button
custom_expected:
For an Approved tx:
THEN form should reload in edit mode
AND a "Save" button should appear in place of the "Edit" button
AND user should be able to attach new files, edit existing attachments, update Comments, and BOC notes
BUT user should not be able to edit Assign To, Assignment Date, Number of days for Rehab, or Reason for Rehab fields

For a Reversed tx:
THEN form should reload in edit mode
AND a "Save" button should appear in place of the "Edit" button
AND user should be able to attach new files, edit existing attachments, update Comments, and BOC notes
AND the user should be able to edit Assign To, Assignment Date, Number of days for Rehab, and Reason for Rehab fields

title: BOC user wants saving Approved Rehab Assignment with an Extension to append "Extended" to player's player history entry
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a BOC user

AND user has added a new Extension to the tx
AND this Extension is the first Extension being added to the tx
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Save"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if an Extension has been added
AND system should add "-EXTENDED" to the Rehabilitation Assignment in the player's Player History

title: User receives error if submitting continuation of rehab with a number of days that exceeds the set limits - Pitcher

AND selected player has a previous rehab assignment
BUT selected player does NOT have a subsequent "Reinstate from IL" tx
AND value entered on new "Place on Rehab Assignment" tx for Number of Days for Rehab + number of days player spent on rehab during his previous assignment is greater than 30
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should display error "A pitcher is only allowed a total of 30 days of consecutive rehab assignments. Current total: {0}."({0} reflects the number of days entered on this form as well as the previously completed rehab days)
AND clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction
AND clicking Ignore and Continue will ignore the error and continue with the transaction (BOC Only)

title: Update On Submit rules for Rehab Assignment
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 10 day IL
custom_steps:
Business Rules:
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2309193

AND

https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2309257

Acceptance Crtieria: 
* 11.15 from the Place on Rehab Assignment should be updated to check if the player is on the 7, 10, or 15 day IL.
* 12.03 and 12.05 from the Transfer of Rehab should be updated to check if the player is on the Rehab 7, 10, or 15 day IL.

title: As a user I want the player to have the proper Roster Status assigned on Rehab Assignment and Return from Rehab
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 10 day IL, on submit rule
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Submitting a Place on Rehab Assignment transaction for a player currently on the 10 Day IL will update the player's pending MJ roster status to "Rehab 10-Day IL". 
* Approving a Place on Rehab Assignment transaction for a player currently on the 10 Day IL will update the player's current MJ roster status to "Rehab 10-Day IL".
* Submitting a Return from Rehab Assignment transaction for a player currently on the Rehab 10-Day IL will update the player's pending MJ Roster status to "10-Day IL".
* Approving a Return from Rehab Assignment transaction for a player currently on the Rehab 10-Day IL will update the player's current MJ Roster status to "10-Day IL".

custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to view, create, or edit a Transfer from Rehab Assignment
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only
BUT user should not be able to see BOC Notes field for any transaction
AND user should not be able to see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
AND user should not be able to see attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: User wants to create a new Return from Rehab tx from player history
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Club or BOC user is logged in and viewing a player's Player History
AND no preliminary, submitted, or rejected Return from Rehab tx exists for the player within the last 10 days
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Create New" button on Player History Widget
custom_expected:
THEN "Transactions" should appear as an option in top-level dropdown
AND "Major" and "Minor" radio buttons should be active
AND selecting "Major" should limit third and fourth levels to only MJ items
AND "Injured List" should be an option under Major Transactions
AND "Return from Rehab" should be an option in the fourth level dropdown
AND selecting "Return from Rehab" will cause the system to load a new preliminary transaction in edit mode
AND all fields should match wireframe and data discovery

title: Club user wants to receive notification when Return from Rehab tx is approved
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Return from Rehab" tx exists for a player
AND a user is logged in as a club user for the initiating club of the tx or the club the player belongs to
custom_steps: WHEN "Return from Rehab" tx reaches an "Approved" state
custom_expected:
THEN the logged in club will receive a notification
AND clicking on "Description" hyperlink in the notification will open the "Transfer of Rehab Assignment" tx in view mode in the same window/tab
AND clicking on Player Name hyperlink in the notification will open the player's Player Profile to the Player History tab in the same window/tab

title: Club user wants to receive notification when Return from Rehab tx is rejected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Return from Rehab" tx exists for a player
AND a user is logged in as a club user for the initiating club of the tx or the club the player belongs to
custom_steps: WHEN "Return from Rehab"  tx reaches a "Rejected" state
custom_expected:
THEN the logged in club will receive a notification
AND clicking on "Description" hyperlink in the notification will open the "Transfer of Rehab Assignment" tx in view mode in the same window/tab
AND clicking on Player Name hyperlink in the notification will open the player's Player Profile to the Player History tab in the same window/tab

title: Club user wants to receive notification when Return from Rehab tx is reversed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Return from Rehab" tx exists for a player
AND tx is not suppressed
AND a user is logged in as a club user for the initiating club of the tx or the club the player belongs to
custom_steps: WHEN "Return from Rehab" tx reaches an "Reversed" state
custom_expected:
THEN the logged in club will receive a notification
AND clicking on "Description" hyperlink in the notification will open the "Transfer of Rehab Assignment" tx in view mode in the same window/tab
AND clicking on Player Name hyperlink in the notification will open the player's Player Profile to the Player History tab in the same window/tab

title: User wants to be able to delete Return from Rehab tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Return from Rehab" tx exists for a player
AND the tx is in a Preliminary or Rejected state
AND a user is logged in with edit permissions for the form 
AND grey "Delete" button is displayed on the form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Delete" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form ("Are you sure you want to delete this ["Return from Rehab"]?"Hint: This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.)
AND yes and no buttons should be displayed
AND clicking yes should close the form with no record kept and return user to entry point of the tx
AND clicking no should return user to the form and take no action
AND deleted tx should not appear on front end or be searchable

title: User wants to receive error if entered return date is after Last Rehab Date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is attempting to submit a "Return from Rehab" tx
AND Return date on the tx is after Last Rehab Date displayed on player's latest Rehab Assignment (including any extensions)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should display error "The return date, {0}, cannot be greater than the last rehab date, {1}."
AND "{0}" should be replaced with the entered return date
AND "{1}" should be replaced with the last rehab date from the player's latest rehab assignment (including any extensions)
AND clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction.
AND clicking Ignore and Continue will ignore the error and continue with the transaction (BOC only)

title: Update On Submit rules for Return from Rehab
custom_preconds: cba change, Injured list, mj - place on 10 day IL
custom_steps:
Business Rules:
https://u8r.jamacloud.com/perspective.req?projectId=14044&docId=2309261

Acceptance Crtieria: 
* 13.03 and 13.05 from the Return from Rehab should be updated to check if the player is on the Rehab 10-Day IL instead of the Rehab 15-Day IL.  (Note: Can be both 10 and 15 day IL)

title: BOC admin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC - Admin user
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to view, edit, or create a "Return from Rehab" tx for a player
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and Print all major league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Major League Players
AND user should be able to view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states
AND user should be able to create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Major league transactions for Major League players
AND user should be able to Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Major League transactions and see associated Flags

title: BOC basic
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC - Basic user
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to view, edit, or create a "Return from Rehab" tx for a player
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and Print all major league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Major League Players

BUT user should not be able to make any changes or e-sign.

title: Club admin - user's Club is "From Org" or "To Org"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has Club-Admin Permissions
AND user is listed as "From Org" or "To Org" on "Return from Rehab" tx
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in as Club-Admin user
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all major league transactions in all states 
AND user should be able to create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign Transfer from Rehab Assignment tx
BUT user should not be able to view transactions in "Suppressed" state
AND user should not be able to view "BOC Notes" field

title: Club basic - user's Club is "From Org" or "To Org"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has Club-Basic Permission
AND user is listed as "From Org" or "To Org" on "Return from Rehab" tx
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in as Club-Basic user
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction 
BUT user should not be able to view transactions in "Suppressed" state
AND user should not be able to edit or change these transactions
AND user should not be able to view "BOC Notes" field

title: Submit a Reinstate from IL tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a "Reinstate from IL" transaction
AND transaction is in preliminary or rejected state
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Submit to BOC" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should run required field and format check
AND any errors should cause the system to generate an error message
AND once all rules pass the system should update transaction status to "Submitted to BOC"
AND system should reload transaction in view mode
AND system should display successful submit blue notification #76
AND players Pending MJ Roster Status should be set to Active
AND an entry should be created in green font in player's Player History: Code = REINS, Description = Reinstate From {Injured List}, From Org/Club and To Org/Club fields
{Injured List} should reference the player's latest IL placement (ex: 7-Day Concussion IL etc)
AND approval item should be generated and display on BOC - Major Transactions = Admin's Approvals Widget
AND any populated comments should display in Comments column of Approvals Widget
AND clicking Player Name hyperlink should open the Player Profile to the Player History tab in the same window/tab
AND clicking on Type hyperlink will open submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab

title: Reverse and suppress a Reinstate from IL tx - not most recent approved tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a "Reinstatement from IL" transaction exists for a player 
AND user is logged in with permission to reverse and suppress the transaction
AND grey "Reverse" button is displayed on the form
BUT selected transaction is not the most recent approved transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Reverse" or "Reverse and suppress" button
custom_expected:
THEN system should display error message "Only the player's latest approved transaction can be reversed."
AND clicking "Back" button should close modal and return user to the transaction

title: User wants to print Notice of Disposition for Reinstate from IL tx
custom_preconds: GIVEN Users have permission to Print from the form will see a "Print" button on the transaction
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks print on the tx in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN a menu will open where the user can choose to print a Notice of Disposition. 
AND Selecting "Notice of Disposition" will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in English if the language on the player's profile is set to anything other than Spanish. 
AND Selecting "Notice of Disposition" will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in Spanish if the language on the player's profile is set to Spanish. 
AND The English pdf will follow the English Notice of Disposition format.
AND The Spanish pdf will follow the Spanish Notice of Disposition format.

title: User wants to print Notice of Disposition for Reinstate from IL  tx
custom_preconds: GIVEN a User that has permission to Print from the form will see a "Print" button
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks print on the tx in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN it will  open a menu where the user can choose to print a Notice of Disposition. 
AND selecting "Notice of Disposition" will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in English if the language on the player's profile is set to anything other than Spanish. 
AND selecting "Notice of Disposition" will generate a pdf of the Notice of Disposition in Spanish if the language on the player's profile is set to Spanish. 
AND the English pdf will follow the English Notice of Disposition format.
AND the Spanish pdf will follow the Spanish Notice of Disposition format.

title: Club user receives error if they are reinstating a player that was on the IL for a concussion
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is attempting to initiate a "Reinstate from IL" transaction for a player
AND selected player has been placed on the IL for a concussion since his latest reinstate from IL transaction
custom_steps: WHEN club user selects "Reinstate from IL" from the Major League Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system should display error message "Please contact the Office of the Commissioner. Only a BOC user can create a {Reinstate from IL} for a player that has been placed on the Injured List due to a concussion."
AND clicking "Back" button will close the modal and return the user to the point of entry

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the player I'm attempting to Reinstate from the MJ IL is at the MN level
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #10.01:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.+Reinstate+from+DL
See Error Message #15:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages
GIVEN a user is attempting to create a new Reinstate from IL transaction for a MJ league player
custom_steps: WHEN user selects "Reinstate From DL" from the Major League Create New menu
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the player's Pending Roster Status is not at the minor league level
AND if the player's pending roster status is at the minor league level, then the user should receive an error
AND if the player does not have a pending roster status, then the current roster status should be used
AND this rule should also be checked on Submit and Approve
AND message should be as follows:
Title: "Error"
Body: "This transaction is for Major League players only."
Button(s): Back
Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the point of entry.

title: As a Club user I want to be prevented from initiating a transaction for a player that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #10.02:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.+Reinstate+from+DL
See Messages #21:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages
GIVEN a club user is attempting to create a Reinstate from IL transaction for an MJ league player
AND the player selected does NOT belong to the org of the logged in user
custom_steps: WHEN user selects "Reinstate From the DL" on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system should check to see if the player's Current Org is set to the Org of the initiating user
AND if the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they should be allowed to create the transaction
BUT if the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the player, then system should display a blocking message
AND message should be as follows:
Body: "You do not have permission to create a transaction for a player that belongs to another Organization."
Hint Text:"If you believe you have received this message in error, please contact the BOC."
Button(s): Back
AND clicking Back will return the user to the entry point

title: Receive error if player does not have a valid MJ roster status
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user wants to Submit or Approve a "Reinstate from IL" transaction 
AND selected player's pending (or current if pending is not populated) major league roster status is not "7-Day Concussion", "10-Day IL", or "60-Day IL"
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit or Approve
custom_expected:
THEN user sees error message "The player must currently be on the Injured List and not currently be on Rehab in order to be Reinstated."
AND clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction

title: Receive error if player has a pending or approved tx after the entered assignment date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user wants to Submit or Approve a "Reinstate from IL" transaction 
AND Placement Date on the transaction is before the latest approved or pending (Pending to Club, Submitted to BOC) transaction date for the player
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit or Approve
custom_expected:
THEN user sees error message "A transaction cannot occur before the date of the player's latest approved or pending transaction, on <TX Date>."
AND clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction
AND clicking Ignore and Continue will ignore the error and continue with the transaction (BOC ONLY)

title: Receive error if entered reinstatement date is before the Earliest Reinstatement Date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to initiate a "Reinstate from IL" transaction for a player
AND reinstatement date entered on the form is before the Earliest Reinstatement Date displayed on the transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit or Approve
custom_expected:
THEN system should display error message "The player cannot be reinstated before the earliest reinstatement date."
AND clicking "Back" button will close the modal and return the user to the transaction
AND clicking "Ignore and Continue" will ignore the error and continue with the transaction (BOC Only)

title: Receive error if user is submitting a tx without "Received Medical Director Approval" checkbox being checked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a player is on 7-day Concussion IL
AND user wants to Submit or Approve a "Reinstate from IL" transaction 
AND "Received Medical Director Approval" checkbox is displayed on the Reinstatement on
AND "Received Medical Director Approval" checkbox is not checked
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit or Approve
custom_expected:
THEN user sees error message "A player must have received Approval from a Medical Director to be reinstated from placement on the IL due to concussion."
AND clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the transaction
AND clicking Ignore and Continue will ignore the error and continue with the transaction (BOC ONLY)

title: As a user I want to receive an error if the player I'm attempting to reinstate from the MJ IL is at the MN level
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #10.05:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.+Reinstate+from+DL
See Error Message #15:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Reinstate from IL transaction for a player at the MJ League level
AND selected player's pending (or current if pending not available) roster status is NOT at the MJ league level
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Submit or Approve
custom_expected:
THEN system should check that the player's Pending Roster Status is not at the minor league level
AND if the player's pending roster status is at the minor league level, then the user should receive an error
AND if the player does not have a pending roster status, then the current roster status is used
AND message should be as follows:
Title: "Error"
Body: "This transaction is for Major League players only."
Button(s): Back
Clicking Back will close the modal and return the user to the point of entry

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I'm attempting to submit a Reinstate from IL transaction without the "Received Return to Play Form" checkbox checked
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #10.08:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.+Reinstate+from+DL
See Error Message #33:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Reinstate from IL transaction for a player at the MJ League level
AND player was on the DL for a concussion at some point during his current DL stint (including any transfers)
AND "Received Return to Play Form" checkbox on the transaction is not checked
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the "Received Return to Play Form" checkbox is checked ONLY if it appears on the form
AND if it is not checked, but is displayed, then system should show an error
AND message should be as follows:
Body: "A player must have received Approval to Return to Play to be reinstated from placement on the DL due to concussion."
Clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction
Clicking Ignore and Continue (only available for the BOC) should ignore the error and continue with the transaction

title: Warning if the MJ League Club's active or under control limit will be exceeded
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #10.09:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.+Reinstate+from+DL
See Error Message #34:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit or approve a Reinstate from IL transaction for a player at the MJ league level
AND the transaction would exceed the active or under control limit for the roster of the player's club
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve" (all places OnSubmit rules are fired)
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the completion of this transaction will put the relevant Major League Club over their under control or active roster limits
AND if yes, then a warning should be shown
AND message should be as follows:
Body: "The club [Major League club name] will exceed the Active List or Under Control limit.
Active Limit: [Limit #] Actual: [Actual#]
Under Control Limit: [Limit #] Actual: [Actual#]"
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction
AND clicking Ignore and Continue should ignore the error and continue with the transaction

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I have back or futuredated my transaction more than 3 days
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #10.12:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.+Reinstate+from+DL
See Error Message #18:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages
GIVEN user is attempting to submit or approve a Reinstate from IL transaction for a player at the MJ league level
AND Reinstatement Date on the transaction is backdated or futuredated more than 3 days
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve" (all places OnSubmit rules are fired)
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the placement date is 3 or more days prior to or after the current date. 
AND if yes, system should display error
AND message should be as follows:
Body: "Reinstatement Date must be within 3 days of submission"
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction
AND clicking Ignore and Continue (only available for the BOC) should ignore the error and continue with the transaction

title: Run required field and formatting check on save(submitted or higher transaction only)
custom_preconds:
See Business Rules 10.39:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.+Reinstate+from+DL
See Data Discovery for required fields:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Reinstate+from+MJ+DL

GIVEN a club or BOC user is viewing a Reinstate from IL transaction in a submitted or higher state
AND transaction is in edit mode
AND one or more required fields is missing
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Save
custom_expected:
THEN required field and formatting check should be run according to attached DD
AND user should receive a blocker for any missing required fields

title: Error if BOC approver attempts to approve a Reinstate from IL transaction with a Reinstatement Date after the current date
custom_preconds:
See Business Rule #10.18:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/10.+Reinstate+from+DL
See Error Message #75:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages
GIVEN a BOC approver user is attempting to approve a Reinstate from IL transaction for a player at the MJ league level
AND Reinstatement Date on the transaction is later than current date
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should check if the current date is after the placement date entered on the transaction
AND if yes, then a warning should be shown
AND message should be as follows:
Body: "This transaction cannot be approved unless the transaction date is on or before the current date."
AND clicking Back should close the modal and return the user to the transaction
BUT f the placement date is on or before the current date, then no error should be shown

title: BOC user wants to be able to edit Last Game Date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user with edit permissions
AND a Place on 7-Day IL tx exists for a player in Preliminary, Rejected, or Submitted state
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the tx in edit mode
custom_expected: THEN BOC user should be able to edit Last Game Date field

title: BOC user should not be able to edit Last Game Date on Approved tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user with edit permissions
AND a Place on 7-Day IL tx exists for a player in Approved state
custom_steps: WHEN user opens the tx in edit mode
custom_expected: THEN BOC user should not be able to edit Last Game Date field

title: User wants Last Game Date to populate based on player's Last Game Stats
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is attempting to create a new Place on 7-Day IL tx for a player
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens the new tx
custom_expected:
THEN the "Last Game Date" field should be populated with the latest date that appears on the stats table for that player 
AND if more than one date appears on the stats table, the most recent date should be used
AND all stats that appear on the the stats table should be used to populate the date
AND stats from a prior year can be used to populate Last Game Date
BUT if no stats appear for the player, the field should remain blank
(note that stats for spring training games will not display on stats tab but these will be included as last game date if the player played a spring training game)
